# teamcity_project_parameter (Resource)

Parameters are name=value pairs that can be referenced throughout TeamCity. Project parameters are available to any Build Configuration inside corresponding project. More info [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/configuring-build-parameters.html)

Supports password-type parameters via the `type` attribute. When `type = "password"`, the parameter is stored securely in TeamCity and the `value` is treated as sensitive (not shown in plan/apply output). The provider uses TeamCity's secure parameter mechanism under the hood.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "teamcity_project_parameter" "project_param" {
  project_id = "_Root"
  name = "env.MY_ENV_PARAM"
  value = "VALUE"
}
```

Password parameter example:

```terraform
resource "teamcity_project_parameter" "secret_param" {
  project_id = "_Root"
  name       = "secret_token"
  type       = "password"
  value      = var.secret_value  # kept sensitive by the provider
}
```

> Important note:
> 
> When using password parameter type and making changes from TeamCity UI, terraform provider will not be able to detect the change and will not update the parameter value because TeamCIty server does not return sensitive passwords via REST API. Only changes via terraform provider will be properly shown in plan.

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String)
- `project_id` (String)
- `value` (String, Sensitive)

### Optional

- `type` (String) Parameter type. Use `password` to create a secure (hidden) parameter. Defaults to `text` if omitted. Changing this forces a new resource.

### Computed

- `id` (String) Resource identifier in the form `project_id/name`.

## Import

```terraform
import {
  to = teamcity_project_parameter.project_param
  id = "_Root/env.MY_ENV_PARAM"
}
```

> Important note:
>
> You cannot import password parameter because TeamCIty server does not return sensitive values via REST API.
